properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Total snowfall amounts of 15 centimetres is expected today. This snow will bring additional weight on structures and trees already covered in freezing precipitation. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T23:59:43-00:00

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain likely today. Precipitation associated with a fast moving low pressure system will move into Eastern Ontario this morning. A few hours of freezing rain are likely before precipitation changes to snow later today. Several centimetres of snow are possible in some areas. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T17:56:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T08:57:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4066736775.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. Snow will continue tonight before ending in the morning with total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm expected. Another system is expected to bring 5 to 10 centimetres of snow Tuesday night. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T13:59:46-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow, heavy at times, in conjunction with strong northwesterly winds gusting to 80 km/h will result in near zero visibilities in blowing snow today. Visibilities may improve along the coast this afternoon as temperatures rise briefly above zero, allowing the snow to mix with drizzle, but colder air and more snowfall will return tonight. Periods of snow and blowing snow are expected again on Wednesday, Wednesday night and possibly Thursday, though snowfall rates are expected to gradually ease, especially along the coast. Total accumulations through Thursday will range between 20 and 40 cm in the communities of Postville and Makkovik, with substantially higher amounts likely inland and over elevated terrain. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-10T00:07:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T08:08:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0875271129.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A more or less extended period of freezing rain is forecast from this morning into early afternoon. Up to 2 millimetres of ice accretion is expected. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T17:35:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T08:36:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3379132790.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Fresh snowfall combined with strong northerly winds gusting up to 90 km/h is resulting in poor visibilities in blowing snow this morning. Conditions are expected to improve in the Nain and Natuashish areas today, and in the Hopedale area tonight, as the snow tapers to scattered flurries. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-10T00:02:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T08:03:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2738532095.2019
Area: Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Snow will continue tonight before ending in the morning with total snowfall amounts near 15 cm expected. A second system approaching from the west will bring further accumulations of snow on Tuesday night and Wednesday. Amounts near 5 cm are currently forecast for Tuesday night, with higher amounts possible in some areas. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T14:09:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T01:24:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0824828224.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Poor visibility in blowing snow is currently being reported along northern sections of the Great Northern Peninsula. Periods of snow and strong winds will continue to produce blowing snow at times this afternoon. Conditions are expected to be variable throughout the day, but will ultimately improve later today as temperatures rise above freezing. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-09T22:06:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T13:28:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1365941199.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Another blast of winter weather today. Precipitation associated with a fast moving low pressure system will move across Eastern Ontario today. Snow at times heavy is expected for areas close to the Quebec border, with snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm possible in a couple of localities by this evening. There is also a risk of freezing rain and ice pellets. Motorists should allow extra time to reach their destination. Untreated roads may become snow covered and slippery. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-09T21:34:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-09T13:35:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4223683676.2019
Area: Gatineau, Deep River - Whitney - Eastern Algonquin Park, Prescott and Russell, Petawawa - Pembroke - Cobden, Barry's Bay - Killaloe, Renfrew - Arnprior - Calabogie, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans
